channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: 1st House Democrat publicly asks Biden to exit race. Boeing delays Starliner’s return
item.description: Biden’s bad week gets worse. Texas Rep. Lloyd Doggett is the first House Democrat to publicly call for him to withdraw his reelection bid. Plus, NASA says Boeing’s Starliner can’t come home (yet).
item.content:encoded: Biden’s bad week gets worse. Texas Rep. Lloyd Doggett is the first House Democrat to publicly call for him to withdraw his reelection bid. Plus, NASA says Boeing’s Starliner can’t come home (yet).
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: In just a few years, half of all states passed bans on trans health care for kids
item.description: The Supreme Court will hear a case on gender-affirming care in the next term after a flurry of legislation. Lower courts have come to conflicting conclusions when these bans were challenged.
item.content:encoded: The Supreme Court will hear a case on gender-affirming care in the next term after a flurry of legislation. Lower courts have come to conflicting conclusions when these bans were challenged.
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin

item.title: 'We’re not stuck.' Why Boeing’s Starliner isn’t returning to Earth (yet)
item.description: The return of Starliner has been indefinitely delayed, but NASA and Boeing say the astronauts will use the spaceship to get home — eventually.
item.content:encoded:
The return of Starliner has been indefinitely delayed, but NASA and Boeing say the astronauts will use the spaceship to get home — eventually.

(Image credit: NASA)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: Ransomware attacks have increased -- causing a global crisis
item.description: Car dealerships across the U.S. and Canada are at a standstill after a cyberattack on a software platform. It's one example of an ongoing global crisis.
item.content:encoded: Car dealerships across the U.S. and Canada are at a standstill after a cyberattack on a software platform. It's one example of an ongoing global crisis.
item.dc:creator: Jenna McLaughlin

item.title: How the Supreme Court immunity ruling could affect Trump's criminal cases
item.description: NPR’s Steve Inskeep talks with legal expert Kim Wehle about how the recent Supreme Court’s immunity ruling may shake up former President Trump’s criminal cases.
item.content:encoded: NPR’s Steve Inskeep talks with legal expert Kim Wehle about how the recent Supreme Court’s immunity ruling may shake up former President Trump’s criminal cases.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: On this July 4th week, we’re handing the mic to 4th graders for a history lesson
item.description: One group was tasked with studying the Quartering Act of 1765. Their podcast was one of nearly 2,000 submitted to NPR’s Student Podcast Challenge.
item.content:encoded: One group was tasked with studying the Quartering Act of 1765. Their podcast was one of nearly 2,000 submitted to NPR’s Student Podcast Challenge.
item.dc:creator: Hosts

item.title: Taliban attend U.N. talks meant to normalize Afghan ties but women are excluded
item.description: The United Nations held a new round of talks on bringing Afghanistan into the international fold. For the first time, the Taliban participated -- but women's rights advocates were not invited.
item.content:encoded: The United Nations held a new round of talks on bringing Afghanistan into the international fold. For the first time, the Taliban participated -- but women's rights advocates were not invited.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: The federal government pours $7 billion into solar energy for low-income households
item.description: The Biden administration is betting more solar energy for low-income homes can both be a climate solution and good for pocketbooks.
item.content:encoded: The Biden administration is betting more solar energy for low-income homes can both be a climate solution and good for pocketbooks.
item.dc:creator: Julia Simon

item.title: How do painted lady butterflies travel such long distances?
item.description: Painted lady butterflies are flying more than 2,600 miles over the Atlantic Ocean without stopping, one of the longest recorded journeys ever taken by a flying insect.
item.content:encoded: Painted lady butterflies are flying more than 2,600 miles over the Atlantic Ocean without stopping, one of the longest recorded journeys ever taken by a flying insect.
item.dc:creator: Hosts

item.title: Angel Reese and Caitlin Clark will play on the same team for the WNBA All-Star game
item.description: Clark and Reese developed a rivalry after facing off in the 2023 NCAA women's basketball championship, and have played against each other since they both were drafted to the WNBA earlier this year.
item.content:encoded:
Clark and Reese developed a rivalry after facing off in the 2023 NCAA women's basketball championship, and have played against each other since they both were drafted to the WNBA earlier this year.

(Image credit: Charles Rex Arbogast)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie
